name: rspet.github.io
tagline: RSPET (Reverse Shell and Post Exploitation Tool)
body:
## About RSPET.
RSPET (Reverse Shell and Post Exploitation Tool) is a Python based reverse shell with functionalities that assist in a post exploitation scenario. It's available to download (as source) through it's [GitHub Repository](https://github.com/panagiks/RSPET) as well as the repos of [BlackArch](blackarch.org/tools.html) and [ArchStrike](https://archstrike.org/packages/search/rspet). RSPET is fully Open Source (released under the MIT license) and open to contributors.

## Key Features
RSPET's key features include:
* TLS encryption of Server-Client communication
* Able to accept and manage multiple clients simultaneously
* Full support for plug-ins on the Server module
* An API for the Server module
* A RESTful WebAPI for the Server module
* An installation script for the Server module that will take care of all dependencies and key generation 
* Both Server and Client fully Open Source
* Extensive Documentation on both the code/design and the usage/expansion/plug-in development 

## Authors and Contributors
### Author
The Author of RSPET is @panagiks, who started the project on March 10th 2016 and is still supporting the project with contributions, bug fixes, feature expansions and more!

### Co-Author
@dzervas came aboard in June 2016 by helping redesign the Server module and implementing the plug-in system, both changes that helped further progress RSPET's capabilities.

### Other Contributors
* @b3mb4m -- Code (tab.py and bug fixes)
* @junzy -- Docstings (udp_spoof & udp_spoof_send)
* @gxskar -- Documentation (ASCIICAST of RSPET's basic execution)
* @n1zzo -- Bug Report & Fix (PR #31)

## Support or Contact
For more information about RSPET feel free to check the project's [Online Documentation](http://rspet.readthedocs.io) which contains extensive documentation on usage cases/examples as well as an analysis of RSPET's inner workings (code structure etc) and a guide for plug-in development. If you have any issue or have found a bug or wish to make a feature request, feel free to open an issue on [RSPET's repository](https://github.com/panagiks/RSPET). Finally, for anything further feel free to contact @panagiks.
